name: Anthurium lineolatum
description: Anthurium lineolatum is an epiphytic plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. It belongs to the Araceae family and features upright stems (20-40 cm tall) with small, dramatic, lance-shaped to linear, dark green leaves with distinctive venation. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Many species have velvety leaves with prominent white or silver veins that create stunning contrast, and some produce fragrant blooms. In tropical forests, this plant typically grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive narrow foliage. It's popular among Anthurium enthusiasts for its compact size and attractive leaves.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
Bright indirect light for best flowering
